revised_title: Infrared Absorption Bands of HCN: Pressure Effects and Rotational Constants
tldr: The authors investigated the infrared absorption spectrum of hydrogen cyanide (HCN) using sensitive photographic plates. They discovered two strong bands at 10,385 Å and 11,645 Å and found that the rotational structure of the bands could be explained by introducing the rotational constant to account for the stretching caused by centrifugal force. The authors also observed a pressure effect on the line width of the absorption bands, which they attributed to pressure broadening. This study provides insights into the molecular structure and properties of HCN.
